tool.name: MetaProSIP
tool.description: Performs proteinSIP on peptide features for elemental flux analysis.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in_mzML && ln -s '$in_mzML' 'in_mzML/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_mzML.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_mzML.ext)' && mkdir in_fasta && ln -s '$in_fasta' 'in_fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_fasta.ext)' && mkdir out_csv && mkdir out_peptide_centric_csv && mkdir in_featureXML && ln -s '$in_featureXML' 'in_featureXML/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_featureXML.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_featureXML.ext)' &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in_mzML 'in_mzML/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_mzML.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_mzML.ext)' -in_fasta 'in_fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_fasta.ext)' -out_csv 'out_csv/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' -out_peptide_centric_csv 'out_peptide_centric_csv/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' -in_featureXML 'in_featureXML/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_featureXML.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_featureXML.ext)'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out_csv/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$out_csv' && mv 'out_peptide_centric_csv/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$out_peptide_centric_csv' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_mzML
param.label: Centroided MS1 data

param.name: in_fasta
param.label: Protein sequence database

param.name: in_featureXML
param.label: Feature data annotated with identifications (IDMapper)

param.name: mz_tolerance_ppm
param.label: Tolerance in ppm

param.name: rt_tolerance_s
param.label: Rolerance window around feature rt for XIC extraction

param.name: intensity_threshold
param.label: Intensity threshold to collect peaks in the MS1 spectrum

param.name: correlation_threshold
param.label: Correlation threshold for reporting a RIA

param.name: xic_threshold
param.label: Minimum correlation to mono-isotopic peak for retaining a higher isotopic peak
param.help: If featureXML from reference file is used it should be disabled (set to -1) as no mono-isotopic peak is expected to be present

param.name: decomposition_threshold
param.label: Minimum R-squared of decomposition that must be achieved for a peptide to be reported

param.name: weight_merge_window
param.label: Decomposition coefficients within +- this rate window will be combined

param.name: plot_extension
param.label: Extension used for plots (png|svg|pdf)

param.name: qc_output_directory
param.label: Output directory for the quality report

param.name: labeling_element
param.label: Which element (single letter code) is labeled

param.name: use_unassigned_ids
param.label: Include identifications not assigned to a feature in pattern detection

param.name: use_averagine_ids
param.label: Use averagine peptides as model to perform pattern detection on unidentified peptides

param.name: report_natural_peptides
param.label: Whether purely natural peptides are reported in the quality report

param.name: filter_monoisotopic
param.label: Try to filter out mono-isotopic patterns to improve detection of low RIA patterns

param.name: cluster
param.label: Perform grouping

param.name: min_correlation_distance_to_averagine
param.label: Minimum difference in correlation between incorporation pattern and averagine pattern
param.help: Positive values filter all RIAs passing the correlation threshold but that also show a better correlation to an averagine peptide. Disabled for values <= -1

param.name: pattern_15N_TIC_threshold
param.label: The most intense peaks of the theoretical pattern contributing to at least this TIC fraction are taken into account

param.name: pattern_13C_TIC_threshold
param.label: The most intense peaks of the theoretical pattern contributing to at least this TIC fraction are taken into account

param.name: pattern_2H_TIC_threshold
param.label: The most intense peaks of the theoretical pattern contributing to at least this TIC fraction are taken into account

param.name: pattern_18O_TIC_threshold
param.label: The most intense peaks of the theoretical pattern contributing to at least this TIC fraction are taken into account

param.name: heatmap_bins
param.label: Number of RIA bins for heat map generation

param.name: observed_peak_fraction
param.label: Fraction of observed/expected peaks

param.name: min_consecutive_isotopes
param.label: Minimum number of consecutive isotopic intensities needed

param.name: score_plot_yaxis_min
param.label: The minimum value of the score axis
param.help: Values smaller than zero usually only make sense if the observed peak fraction is set to 0

param.name: collect_method
param.label: How RIAs are collected

param.name: lowRIA_correlation_threshold
param.label: Correlation threshold for reporting low RIA patterns
param.help: Disable and take correlation_threshold value for negative values

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Performs proteinSIP on peptide features for elemental flux analysis.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/UTILS_MetaProSIP.html
